points.title: Oshawa Trail Entrance
points.description: The Waterfront Trail in Oshawa begins here!

points.title: Lakefront West Park
points.description: Located along the shores of Lake Ontario this park provides a number of active and passive recreational opportunities.  Enjoy views of Lake Ontario, stroll along the Waterfront Trail or watch a ball game.
points.hours: April 1 to October 31: 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. | November 1 to March 31: 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

points.title: Renaissance Park
points.description: This park provides a number of active and passive recreational opportunities where families of all ages can come and enjoy an afternoon of fun, playing on the playground and sports fields or relaxing under the Gazebo or one of the many shade trees planted in the park.
points.hours: April 1 to October 31 - 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. | November 1 to March 31 - 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

points.title: Stone Street Park
points.description: This park provides a number of active and passive recreational opportunities where families of all ages can come and enjoy an afternoon of fun, playing on the playground and sports fields or relaxing under the Gazebo or one of the many shade trees planted in the park. There are 4 outdoor tennis courts at this park location. Courts 1 & 2 are lined for both tennis and pickleball play. Courts 3 & 4 are newly resurfaced and lined for tennis play only. All courts have an asphalt surface and lights for evening play.
points.hours: April 1 to October 31 - 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. | November 1 to March 31 - 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

points.title: South Oshawa Community Centre
points.description: South Oshawa Community Centre features a leisure pool with waterslide, fitness centre, youth room and meeting rooms complete with a teaching kitchen. Situated on the Lake Ontario waterfront and attached to GL Roberts Collegiate and Vocational Institute, facility users have easy access to Stone Street Park, the Waterfront Trail and a playground. A variety of recreation programs are offered at this facility.
points.hours: South Oshawa Community Centre will be closed until further notice.

points.title: Pumphouse Marsh
points.description: The Pumphouse Marsh is a provincially significant wetland and barrier beach that students from the neighbouring schools use for field research.

points.title: Lakewoods Park
points.description: This park provides a number of active and passive recreational opportunities where families of all ages can come and enjoy an afternoon of fun, playing on the playground and sports fields or relaxing under the Gazebo or one of the many shade trees planted in the park.
points.hours: April 1 to October 31 - 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. | November 1 to March 31 - 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

points.title: Lakeview Park
points.description: Nestled along the shore of Lake Ontario, Lakeview Park with its mature landscape setting has views of the lake and is a beautiful, community park. Connected to the recreational trails, Joseph Kolodzie Oshawa Creek Bike Path and the Waterfront Trail, visitors can connect to the historic Oshawa Community Museum among other attractions. The Park is also home to the Jubilee Pavilion which provides a banquet hall and public meeting place. Come stretch your legs or sit and relax by the lake.
points.hours: April 1 to October 31 - 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. | November 1 to March 31 - 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m

amenities.title: Lakeview Park Playground and Splash Pad
Jubilee Pavillion Banquet and Conference Centre

points.title: Lakeview Park Beach
points.description: Lakeview Park Beach is a sandy beach located on the shore of Lake Ontario within Lakeview Park and is a popular destination offering museums, picnic areas, playgrounds, sports fields, and a waterfront pier.

points.title: Hamilton Oshawa Port Authority
points.description: The Hamilton Oshawa Port Authority operates the harbour. The Oshawa Harbour played an important role in the settling of our area, and has continued that function as a vital element of the City's growth and economic development today.

points.title: Ed Broadbent Park / Larry Ladd Trail
points.description: Throughout the 19th and 20th centuries, numerous industrial activities occured in the Oshawa Harbour area. Uses have included coal storage, oil storage, and waste material storage. Remedial works have occurred on the site to allow the area to be open for public use which includes the Larry Ladd Harbourfront Trail and bridge was constructed in 2018, and runs diagonally across the site. The trail links Lakeview Park to Harbour Road. The park was officially named Ed Broadbent Waterfront Park in September, 2019, to recognize the contributions Mr. Broadbent has made to public service and the City of Oshawa and its residents, workers, and businesses.

points.title: Oshawa Second Marsh
points.description: Oshawa Second Marsh is a provincially significant wetland located in the southeast end of Oshawa. The 123-hectare wetland ecosystem drains an area of just over 100 square kilometres, including the Harmony Creek and its tributaries. It is accessible to the public, with bridges, lookout towers, and boardwalks throughout. Friends of Second Marsh is a non-profit environmental organization developed to protect, rehabilitate and showcase the  native bio-diversity of Second Marsh and its watershed.
